column4: DanSchnell...only thing i could suggest is dropping into a terminal and typing "sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg" and make sure framebuffer isn't enabled...if that doesn't help, then i dunno
tell your friend to right click on my computer and go to properties
then click on the next tab to the right, he will find his computer's name and his workgroup's name listed there
i don't think he had any workgroups setup...i tried to enable one, which was defaulted to MSHOME...and i have to restart, so we'll see how that goes
ah you ran the network setup wizard?
yup...i figured it would have been enabled by default, but i guessed wrong
I as well. Does it seem to work now?
grr this is strange, reboot your computer just in case

I dont understand what could possibly be wrong though. The windows machines in my house don't require authentication to connect to me, and if you are using my config file it wouldnt make sense for it to not work
I'm sorry I couldn't help you :(
it's all good...maybe i'll just start over again and hope it works
quick question, tho....what do the ;'s at the beginning of the lines mean?
It means the lines are commented out
not sure why you are having so much trouble
it's all good...i like a challenge from time to time
